required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Burden of Invasive Group B Streptococcal (GBS) Disease in Young Infants in China
clinical_study.official_title: Burden of Invasive Group B Streptococcal (GBS) Disease in Young Infants in China: Incidence, Case Fatality Rate and Serotype Distribution

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the burden of invasive group B streptococcal (GBS) disease in young infants (up to 90 days of age) in China, in terms of incidence, case fatality rate and serotype distribution

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of group B streptococcal (GBS) disease
primary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to 90 days of age

primary_outcome.measure: Case Fatality Rate of GBS disease
primary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to 90 days of age
From birth to 90 days of age

study_pop.textblock: Infants (up to and including 90 days of age) born in or treated in a study hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Positive culture for GBS from one or more of the following normally sterile sites: blood, cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), pleural fluid, peritoneal fluid, pericardial fluid, surgical aspirate, bone, joint fluid, suprapubic bladder aspiration or internal body site (e.g., lymph node, brain).
2. â‰¤90 days old at the time of GBS confirmation.
3. Voluntary written informed consent provided.
Exclusion Criteria:
- None.

facility.name: Guangzhou Women and Children's Medical Centre

reference.citation: Heath PT, Schuchat A. Perinatal group B streptococcal disease. Best Pract Res Clin Obstet Gynaecol. 2007 Jun;21(3):411-24. Epub 2007 Mar 2. Review.
